intro: Anthospermum ciliare var. scabrum, commonly known as the rough-stemmed anthospermum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
